alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Webster (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 09 at 10:29AM CDT until May 09 at 11:00AM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1100 AM CDT FOR NORTHWESTERN JEWELL...SMITH...SOUTHEASTERN PHILLIPS...EASTERN FRANKLIN AND SOUTHERN WEBSTER COUNTIES... At 1029 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Upland to 10 miles north of Athol to near Glade, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. These severe storms will be near... Smith Center around 1045 AM CDT. Bellaire around 1055 AM CDT. Cedar and Inavale around 1100 AM CDT. Lebanon around 1105 AM CDT. Red Cloud and Gaylord around 1110 AM CDT. Esbon, Cowles and Harlan around 1115 AM CDT. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Intense thunderstorm lines can produce brief tornadoes and widespread significant wind damage. Although a tornado is not immediately likely, it is best to move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. These storms may cause serious injury and significant property damage.
